x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.problem_statement: Non-profit organizations often struggle to efficiently coordinate volunteers and donations during community drives or ongoing social initiatives. Manual tracking of volunteers, mismatched donation requests, and lack of visibility into real-time needs lead to wasted effort and slower community impact.
x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.project_name: HopeLink – Unified Volunteer & Donation Management Platform

How do you envision the ideal solution to this  problem?

 

Which ServiceNow products or capabilities would be used?

HopeLink will act as a centralized ServiceNow platform connecting donors, volunteers, and NGOs.
NGOs can post real-time needs (food, clothes, funds, manpower).
Volunteers can register, view available opportunities, and track their impact hours.
Donors can contribute items or funds and see how their donations are being used.
Automation assigns volunteers based on skillset, location, and availability.
Dashboards visualize donation impact, volunteer participation, and beneficiary reach.

ServiceNow Customer Service Management (CSM): For NGO and donor interaction and case management.
ServiceNow App Engine Studio: To build custom volunteer and donation modules.
ServiceNow Flow Designer: To automate matching between requests, donations, and volunteers.
ServiceNow Performance Analytics: For impact measurement and reporting.
ServiceNow Mobile App: For volunteers to check in/out and update task completion on-site.
